dict.string: please refer to our frequently asked questions (FAQ) by following this link: http://www.codeux.com/textual/help/Frequently-Asked-Questions.kb

if you keep receiving disconnects due to a timeout in Textual, then chances are good that there is an intermediate connection issue between you and the IRC network being connected to. For more information see: http://is.gd/xKPIdV
Textual automatically attempts SASL PLAIN authentication on servers that support it. See this link for more information: http://is.gd/7LY1GH
please view https://github.com/Codeux/Textual/blob/Textual-5/README.md for information on compiling Textual.
Textual 4 does not support OS X Yosemite. You will need to buy Textual 5 available here: http://www.codeux.com/textual/ For questions regarding the upgrade see this link: http://is.gd/QLNYoP

the issues with Textual's topic bar on OSX Yosemite is caused by a technology maintained by Apple that Textual uses to display the chat. We have reported the issue to them. See this link for more information: http://is.gd/qEIlUL
please have a look at this link for help with fixing issues with the Textual input field not saving your settings http://is.gd/efLagb
see this link to learn how to import and export your Textual preferences: http://is.gd/hUp15p

Textual 5 is a seperate application from Textual 4 and cannot read your old preferences, however If you are running Textual 4.1.8, then migration of preferences has already happened on your behalf. Otherwise you may download our Migration Assistant from this location: http://is.gd/BdkjdC. If you wish to log to text file you need to set the directory again as this setting is not possible to migrate.
see this link to learn how to add a new, or override an existing keyboard shortcut in Textual: http://is.gd/jhKlVY
see this link for information on how to write Objective-C plug-ins for Textual: http://is.gd/bUJqPJ
see this link for information on how to write scripts for Textual: http://is.gd/5FAouf
see this link for information on how to create and edit styles for Textual: http://is.gd/RlJAQS
see this link for a list of some of the 3rd party plug-ins, scripts, and styles for Textual: http://is.gd/AL8mcU
here is a list of commands that are built into the Textual IRC Client: http://is.gd/aLLdvC
here is a list of keyboard shortcuts that are built into the Textual IRC Client: http://is.gd/jhKlVY
you can sign up to the Textual newsletter to get pre-release copies of Textual at http://is.gd/urItDO
